text: Oblique Apollo 16 image, facing north with Mare Moscoviense in the background Oblique Lunar Orbiter 5 image Leonov is a small lunar impact crater that lies to the south of Mare Moscoviense, one of the few maria on the far side of the Moon. This crater has a heart-shaped outline, due to an outward bulge along the northwest side. The rim of Leonov is worn, and several tiny craterlets lie along the edge. The inner walls and interior floor are relatively featureless. In 1970, the crater was named after Russian cosmonaut Alexei Leonov,Leonov, Gazetteer of Planetary Nomenclature, International Astronomical Union (IAU) Working Group for Planetary System Nomenclature (WGPSN) the first human to perform an extravehicular activity (EVA or "spacewalk") in Earth orbit in 1965. ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Impact craters on the Moon Category:Alexei Leonov
title: Leonov (crater)
